metadata.Title: CVE-2016-1671 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Google Chrome before 50.0.2661.102 on Android mishandles / (slash) and \(backslash) characters, which allows attackers to conduct directorytraversal attacks via a file: URL, related to net/base/escape.cc andnet/base/filename_util.cc.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1671` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 50.0.2661.102-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1237
chromium-browser-l10n - 50.0.2661.102-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1237
chromium-chromedriver - 50.0.2661.102-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1237
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 50.0.2661.102-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1237
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 50.0.2661.102-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1237
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '50.0.2661.102-0ubuntu0.16.04.1.1237').
